DataElement.preferredName: Parent Age of Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates a parent meets the eligibility requirements for participation in a clinical trial with regards to their age at enrollment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Parent Age of Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A mother or a father; an immediate progenitor._The age of a subject when entering a group, catalog, list, or study._In clinical trials, requirements that must be met for a person to be included in a trial. These requirements help make sure that participants in a trial are like each other in terms of specific factors such as age, type and stage of cancer, general health, and previous treatment. When all participants meet the same eligibility criteria, it is more likely that results of the study are caused by the intervention being tested and not by other factors or by chance.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A mother or a father; an immediate progenitor.

Concepts.definition: A mother or a father; an immediate progenitor.

Property.preferredName: Age of Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The age of a subject when entering a group, catalog, list, or study.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The age of a subject when entering a group, catalog, list, or study.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
